description: This course explores the changing structure of American business, the role of the individual in
business development, and the challenges and opportunities that the corporate system poses for
individuals, government, and society in general. The course uses basic economic concepts but
does not require extensive knowledge of economic theory. The course follows a topics-based
approach, considering the evolution of business and contemporary issues confronting
corporations. Class discussions, small group activities, and guest speakers provide a varied
pedagogical approach. Offered occasionally during Interim.
